course.subject: ENVR
course.name: Environment and Health
course.description: This course is intended for UG students of all backgrounds. The course will cover concepts in environmental health including topics on outdoor and indoor environments, workplace, water and sewage, food, genetically modified organism, solid waste, communicable diseases, vectors and control, injury prevention, ionizing and non-ionizing radiation, nanomaterials, environmental health standards, monitoring methods, energy related health issues, natural and manmade disasters, etc. The discussions on each of these topics will include nature of the issue, known and potential health effects, control and regulatory approaches. Local and regional examples will be used where applicable.

reviews.author: bubububu
reviews.title: Good grading
reviews.comment_content: Basic knowledge on the environment, such as air pollution, sludge treatment and waste treatment etc. Overall is simple.
reviews.comment_teaching: A little bit boring because most of the things are quite simple and some of them are just common sense, like the 5Rs.

reviews.author: Angusch
reviews.title: Environment and Health
reviews.comment_content: The content are quite interesting and most of them are related to daily life.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is quite boring but is clear. Occasionally there will be videos but mostly powerpoint slides reading and some explains. Overall is not bad. Professors changes according to Course Topics. There are mainly 2 professors with 1 guest lecturer but the guest lecturer content is not examed.
reviews.comment_grading: Good grade. Step mean in Final and Mid term, fair grad for Project already got B+. If high 1 SD for either Final or Mid term should get A or A+. Mid term and final all MCs. 45 questions each time. All of them are from the powerpoint slides directly and nearly none from the videos played. A large content is factual information directly copied. So if you have good memory, take this course.
reviews.comment_workload: Only one Project, one mid term and one Final. Have IPRS occasionally but the professors will upload the powerpoint one day before lecture, if theres IPRS there will be a slide stating. So if theres no such slide in the powerpoint which means u can sleep longer. You need to submit the project and present in class.

reviews.author: Cony
reviews.comment_content: Basically the relationship of health and environment. For example, occupational health, global warming, air pollution, municipal waste, risk management and water quality etc. very rich content. if you are interested in environmental and health issues, this course suits you a lot.
reviews.comment_teaching:
TBH the class is a bit boring as the professors just read out the slide.
In the first few  lessons, the learning atmosphere was quite nice, the prof would ask questions to students. but after several lessons, some students skipped the class and some slept in the class. so the prof gave up asking questions and just read the ppt slide.
the two prof are very nice in helping with our project. they gave us lots of advice and guided us to do step by step.
reviews.comment_grading:
I think the grading is very nice. since I didn't pay much effort in this course and I totally didn't revise for the final exam. I still got a B+. So this should be a good grading common core. And I don't know why even I skipped most of the lesson and didn't take the IPRS, they still gave me full mark of IPRS.

Midterm (25%)
Final (25%)
Project (30%)
IPRS (20%)
reviews.comment_workload: comparatively low workload compare to other common core course. the project was not difficult at all but require you to have real-taste of what you have chosen to do. However, some of the dates of project (depends on your own group )may clash the time of your revision, so have a better time management is fine.

reviews.author: tanat
reviews.comment_content:
- Many health related environmental issue taught, you will be delighted if you love to study about the environment.
- Relatively easy. Some are just common sense.
reviews.comment_teaching:
- Professors explain the content very well. Feel free to ask them when you have questions.
- They are very nice and are wiling to help us on our project.
- iPRS in almost every lesson, part are only asking your opinion.
reviews.comment_grading:
- Both mid-term and final are in MC format. If you pay attention in class, and revise the ppts, they will be very easy. And some of the questions are from the iPRS.
- The project doesn't have to be in very detail, just if your idea is good  (sticking to ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH) and you can present your observation/ experiment well, your marks won't be bad.
reviews.comment_workload:
- Light workload, just one group project and one presentation to do. And the project won't use you a lot of time. As this is a common core, the project and the presentation are not required to be in very detail, different from the business and science courses.
- Some project directions need to be uploaded to the Canvas first.
- You have to make some time to meet the professors if your project need machinery support.

reviews.title: Envr 1030
reviews.comment_content: It’s actually basic stuff, mainly talked about the health impacts of different environmental problems such as water pollution, climate change, improper waste disposal etc. The content is easy to follow you can just look at the slides and read by yourself.
reviews.comment_teaching: The two professors are nice and they are willing to help if you have any problems in lessons and projects. They have iprs for every lessons but usually the iprs are just some surveys asking about your opinions and thoughts on certain environmental health issues.
reviews.comment_grading:
25% Midterm
25% Final
Project presentation 12%
Peer evaluation( mid-way and final), project topic and plan 2% each
Project personal reflection 10%
Iprs (attendance) 20%

Midterm and finals are all mcs

The grading is fair as the professors are not to strict in giving out grades. The mean for the project stuff are all full marks. Also for iprs, you only need to answer 80% of them to get full marks.

Didn’t know my marks for presentation and finals, midterm was a few marks lower than the mean. And I got a B+
reviews.comment_workload:
Finals and midterm are all mcs so I think it’s okay. But there’s a lot of stuff to remember as there are many slides in one ppt. The exams are not cumulative. The exams asked about very minor stuffs in the PowerPoint but mainly if you can memorise all the figures and words in the ppt, you’ll be fine. But for midterm there’s really a lot of things to remember I’d say.

The project is fun as we have to think of a project topic we’re interested in. We got to go to the lab to borrow the equipment needed and do the experiments there. Have enough time for the project and no need to hand in report only a presentation in class so don’t worry.

reviews.author: zrs
reviews.comment_content: The content is fairly straightforward. I stopped paying attention at some points because the content was so easy to grasp.
reviews.comment_teaching: It can be hard to pay attention when the content is so easy. however, i though the professors did a good job at keeping class interactive with iPRS.
reviews.comment_grading:
25% Midterm
25% Final
12% Presentation
10% Presentation Paper
8% Presentation Formalities (Peer Reviews and Proposals)
20% PRS Attendance

Make sure that you memorize slides because they test you on really small details presented in them. Somewhat unfair considering it didn't have to be that hard.
reviews.comment_workload: Very manageable course load.  Just make sure that you put some effort into your experimental learning project. They mainly want you to focus on the health effects of you project, and less on raw data that you collected in your experiment.

reviews.comment_grading:
I am not sure. I have tried my best already, but I only got B-.

One optional essay. A review of a lecture/ talk.Optional for extra credits 10%.
I got 9/10.

One midterm one final. All MCs. It seems that it is easy, but you really need to spend a lot of time on revision (rich rich rich content!!!!)
Have iPRS.
One experimental learning project. It requires you to borrow the equipment in lab to do some experiment. The professor did not give many instruction and encouraged you to do anything, but just remember your ability. My group have talked to professor several times, he suggested us to do about the BPA in plastic bottle.We go to this direction, but the professor told us that we could not do the experiment as we did not have the knowledge to use the needed equipment.
